If it happened once or twice\, I would let it slide but it felt like the game was made with a first day patch in mind. From a graphics standpoint\, I expected much more. The graphics are improved since the last game circa 2013\, which is expected\, yet are not as groundbreaking as I have heard from friends. They are quite similar if not slightly worse than the graphics from 'RDR2' and 'GOW' which came out more than two years ago. That being said\, the graphics were one of the things I enjoyed about the game. The story was difficult to get through. I was able to understand characters motivations but felt that the execution was lacking. I enjoyed Ellies relationship with Dina but could not connect with any of the other new characters in the same way. I felt that Jesse's character in particular could have been fleshed out more given the games running time\, which ran longer than the first. It made me hard to sympathise with these new characters when the revenge plot kicks in. I think the game lacks the ambiguity of its predecessor. The first game made characters organically feel grey. Joel\, Marlene\, Bill and Ellie all had their own intentions that you could understand even if you disagreed with it. Most of the  characters in the first seemed to show human emotion towards their actions\, both the good and the bad yet the sequel strays from this. Even the worst characters in the first showed a glimpse of humanity in their actions yet the sequel takes all of the humanity out of the characters.
